Think that compiler is just telling you th=
at there is no default constructor
in the parent class.
Try adding

public =
TestCase(String name){
    Super(name);
} 

and see how you get on.

 -----=

I am using Eclipse 1.0 with JUnit, but =
when I create my TestCase subclass, I
get an error on that line that states=

"The constructor junit.framework.TestCase() is not visible"

I am using =
JUnit 3.7.

Here is my code:

import junit.f=
ramework.TestCase;

public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {

}
